definition: the four tones of Middle Chinese: level tone 平聲|平声, rising tone 上聲|上声, departing tone 去聲|去声 and entering tone 入聲|入声/the four tones of Modern Standard Mandarin
four/4
sound/voice/tone/noise/reputation/classifier for sounds
(bird species of China) Indian cuckoo (Cuculus micropterus)
fourth tone in Mandarin/falling tone

sentences.english: You know the four tones and the stuff. It really freaks me out.
sentences.chinese: 你知道四聲那些東西，真夠煩的。

sentences.english: Therefore, relevant historical literature recording his ignorance of four tones was unreliable.
sentences.chinese: 有關文獻關於梁武帝不知四聲的記載是不可靠的。

sentences.english: Four explosions shattered the stillness of the night air.
sentences.chinese: 四聲爆炸聲打破了夜晚的寧靜。

sentences.english: I think this is an Indian Cuckoo.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲這只是四聲杜鵑。

definition: entering tone/checked tone/one of the four tones of Middle Chinese
variant Chinese character
second tone
tone/note/a tone (on a Chinese syllable)/CL:個|个[ge4]
syllable
meaning of a character
level or even tone/first and second tones in modern Mandarin
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
phonetic change
regular verse/strict poetic form with eight lines of 5, 6 or 7 syllables and even lines rhyming
evenly rising tone, the second tone of putonghua
falling tone/fourth tone in modern Mandarin
falling and rising tone/third tone in modern Mandarin
to transliterate/to transcribe/to transfer words onto a surface by direct contact (as with a decal)
pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
